rationale: The species is widespread within the Central Africa assessment region and is assessed as Least Concern.
evaluator: Brummett, R., Mbe Tawe, A.N., Dening Touokong, C., Reid, G.M., Snoeks, J. Staissny, M., Moelants, T., Mamonekene, V., Ndodet, B., Ifuta, S.N.B., Chilala, A., Monsembula, R., Ibala Zamba, A., Opoye Itoua, O., Pouomogne, V., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.

rationale: This species has a wide distribution, with no known major widespread threats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for western Africa, although it is noted that it is threatened particularly from oil exploration in Nigeria and locally impacted by agricultural development, urbanisation and deforestation.  It is estimated that less than 5 % of the species is found in the central Africa region and it has therefore been assessed as Not Applicable.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
